inclusion.criterion: Adults with age of 20 years old or above
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients with symptoms of urgency frequency and/or urge incontinence and urodynamically proven DHIC (defined by the International Continence Society (ICS) recommendation as: spontaneous detrusor contraction occurring during bladder filling phase or occurring before uninhibited detrusor contraction voiding at bladder capacity of less than 350ml in the urodynamic study, and has postvoid residual of more than 100ml but less than 250ml)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Free of active urinary tract infection
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Free of bladder outlet obstruction on enrollment
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Free of overt neurogenic bladder dysfunction
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Having been treated with antimuscarinic agents for at least 1 months without effect or with intolerable adverse effects
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Patient or his/her legally acceptable representative has signed the written informed consent form
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Use of antimuscarinic agent and effective in treatment of lower urinary tract symptoms
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Patients with severe cardiopulmonary disease and such as congestive heart failure, arrhythmia, poorly controlled hypertension, not able to receive regular follow-up
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient has multiple prior admissions for UTIs, altered mental status, and urosepsis. Has a non-obstructing stone in the L ureter and significant leaking around suprapubic cath site.
